title: Accordion
description: A collapsible list for displaying and organizing information.
intro: The Accordion component is a versatile and easy-to-use component that allows you to display a list of headers, each of which can be clicked to expand or collapse the associated content. This makes it a great choice for organizing content in a compact and user-friendly way.

body.raw:
## Installation

```tsx
import { Accordion } from '@rewind-ui/core';
```

When you change a source file, Contentlayer automatically updates the content cache, which prompts Next.js to reload the content on screen. Cool!!

```tsx
<Accordion defaultItem="item-1">
  <Accordion.Item anchor="item-1">
    <Accordion.Header>Header</Accordion.Header>
    <Accordion.Body>Body</Accordion.Body>
  </Accordion.Item>

  <Accordion.Item anchor="item-2">
    <Accordion.Header>Header</Accordion.Header>
    <Accordion.Body>Body</Accordion.Body>
  </Accordion.Item>

  <Accordion.Item anchor="item-3">
    <Accordion.Header>Header</Accordion.Header>
    <Accordion.Body>Body</Accordion.Body>
  </Accordion.Item>
</Accordion>
```

title: Button
description: A clickable element that can function as either a hyperlink or a regular button.
intro: The Button component is a versatile component that can function as either a regular button or an anchor link element. It can be configured in a variety of ways by adjusting properties such as size, color and more.

body.raw:
# Import
---
Import the Button component using the following import statement.

```tsx
import { Button } from '@rewind-ui@core';
```

# Variants
---
The Button component comes with a number of pre-defined variants that can be used to change the appearance of the component. The variants can be used by passing the variant name as a prop to the component. A variant is basically a pre-set set of properties and can be modified by using the...

Available variants are: `primary`, `secondary`, `tertiary`, `link`, `danger`, `success`, `warning` and `info`.

<View>
  <Button variant="primary">Primary</Button>
  <Button variant="secondary">Secondary</Button>
  <Button variant="tertiary">Tertiary</Button>
  <Button variant="link">Link</Button>
  <Button variant="danger">Danger</Button>
  <Button variant="success">Success</Button>
  <Button variant="warning">Warning</Button>
  <Button variant="info">Info</Button>
</View>

```tsx
<View>
  <Button variant="primary">Primary</Button>
  <Button variant="secondary">Secondary</Button>
  <Button variant="tertiary">Tertiary</Button>
  <Button variant="link">Link</Button>
  <Button variant="danger">Danger</Button>
  <Button variant="success">Success</Button>
  <Button variant="warning">Warning</Button>
  <Button variant="info">Info</Button>
</View>
```

# Tones & Colors
---
The Button component comes with four tones: `solid`, `light`, `outline` and `transparent`.

The available `color` values are: `white`, `blue`, `red`, `green`, `yellow`, `purple`, `gray`, `dark` and `black`.

## Solid tone
<View>
  <Button color="white">White</Button>
  <Button color="blue">Blue</Button>
  <Button color="red">Red</Button>
  <Button color="green">Green</Button>
  <Button color="yellow">Yellow</Button>
  <Button color="purple">Purple</Button>
  <Button color="gray">Gray</Button>
  <Button color="dark">Dark</Button>
  <Button color="black">Black</Button>
</View>

```tsx
<View>
  <Button color="white">White</Button>
  <Button color="blue">Blue</Button>
  <Button color="red">Red</Button>

  <Button color="yellow">Yellow</Button>
  <Button color="purple">Purple</Button>
  <Button color="gray">Gray</Button>
  <Button color="dark">Dark</Button>
  <Button color="black">Black</Button>
</View>
```

## Light tone
<View>
  <Button tone="light" color="white">White</Button>
  <Button tone="light" color="blue">Blue</Button>
  <Button tone="light" color="red">Red</Button>
  <Button tone="light" color="green">Green</Button>
  <Button tone="light" color="yellow">Yellow</Button>
  <Button tone="light" color="purple">Purple</Button>
  <Button tone="light" color="gray">Gray</Button>
  <Button tone="light" color="dark">Dark</Button>
  <Button tone="light" color="black">Black</Button>
</View>

```tsx

  <Button tone="light" color="blue">Blue</Button>
  <Button tone="light" color="red">Red</Button>
  <Button tone="light" color="green">Green</Button>
```

title: Checkbox
description: A clickable element that can function as either a hyperlink or a regular button.
intro: The Checkbox component is a versatile component that can function as either a regular button or an anchor link element. It can be configured in a variety of ways by adjusting properties such as size, color and more.

body.raw:
# Import
---
Import the Checkbox component using the following import statement.

```tsx
import { Checkbox } from '@rewind-ui@core';
```
